remarks: A wff ` th ` containing a conditional operator is true when both of its cases are true.  (Contributed by NM, 15-Feb-2015.)
statement:
ifboth.1 $e |- ( A = if ( ph , A , B ) -> ( ps <-> th ) ) $.
ifboth.2 $e |- ( B = if ( ph , A , B ) -> ( ch <-> th ) ) $.
ifbothda.3 $e |- ( ( et /\ ph ) -> ps ) $.
ifbothda.4 $e |- ( ( et /\ -. ph ) -> ch ) $.
ifbothda $p |- ( et -> th ) $.
